page.title: 12RUBBISH DUMP LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: The rubbish dump is on the outskirts of Lossiemouth beside the A941 and is surrounded by woods on three sides. It was closed at the start of September 1985 because it was full up. The disadvantages in the location of the dump were the smells, which reached nearby houses, and the litter which blew into the woods. To stop that from happening the council put nets round it but that was only partly succesful. As a result when people came into Lossiemouth the dump was an eyesore. The seagulls, which are a nuisance in town because they make nests and attack people, all came to the dump to look for food. Now the dump is closed they will probably come into Lossie scavenging. The closure of the dump has brought pleased reactions from the people nearby.
